title: Rotational kinematics - angular speeds of globes

content.question: A sphere is spinning with initial angular speed <math alttext="omega sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> when it begins slowing at a constant angular acceleration of magnitude <math alttext="alpha sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. After rotating through an angular displacement of <math alttext="delta theta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, the sphere comes to rest. A second identical sphere has initial angular speed <math alttext="omega sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> when it begins slowing at a constant angular acceleration of magnitude <math alttext="2 alpha sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. The second sphere rotates through the same angular displacement <math alttext="delta theta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> before coming to rest. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="omega sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> to <math alttext="omega sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="omega sub 2 equals the fraction omega sub 1 over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="omega sub 2 equals the fraction omega sub 1 over the square root of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="omega sub 2 equals the square root of 2, end root, omega sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="omega sub 2 equals 2 omega sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="omega sub 2 equals the square root of 2, end root, omega sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
